results.title: When love comes
results.creator_credit: MF Films, New Zealand Film Commission, Jonathan Dowling, Michele Fantl and Garth Maxwell
results.brief_description: Uneven ensemble drama about the value of friendship, intimacy and love. When Katie (Rena Owen), a one hit wonder and faded singer, returns to Auckland after ten years in LA to find new direction in her life, she takes refuge with Stephen, her oldest friend, who is in a difficult relationship with the much younger Mark, a songwriter, substance abuser and ex rent boy. Mark writes songs for a punky energetic young dyke couple who are in a rock band together and who encourage Katie to sing with them. Together they take off to a remote beach house where Stephen and Mark finally confront the demons that shape and inhibit their relationship. More secrets are revealed and needs exposed when Katie’s American lover arrives on the scene. Cast also includes Simon Prast and Dean O’Gorman.

results.title: When it comes to people...
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Richard Mason and Roland Beckett
results.brief_description: In today’s industry, the conservation of human resources is vital. This film shows how employers keep their staff happy and increase output as well. Gives three examples of improved production as a result of studies by a productivity group: one in a clay pipe industry, one in an insurance office and one in a machine shop. The lessons to be learnt are applicable to many other industries.

results.title: When in pain
results.creator_credit: Shepard Menken, Claire Menken and Jerome Karasic
results.brief_description: Analyses aspects of physical and emotional pain, and examines the brain’s never-ending battle with the pain of anxiety, of alleviating pain and removing the source of pain.

results.title: When I say no I feel guilty
results.brief_description: Deals with assertiveness and verbal traps such as being manipulated, side tracked, sensitive to criticism, and being unable to say ‘no’. Verbal skills discussed include: broken record, fogging, negative assertion, negative inquiry, free information self-disclosure.

results.title: When I am rich
results.creator_credit: New Fields and Derek Phillips Animation
results.brief_description: Our hero dreams of winning a lot of money, buying new clothes and a car, then having a grand party. Short animated satire on the desire for personal wealth. The moral of the film is that the idea of suddenly gaining personal wealth is very attractive, including the delusion that it will bestow power and influence. However, desires are only dreams: it is more realistic to build one’s happiness on one’s true situation.

results.title: When I'm calling you (NP)
results.brief_description: A lesson on the use of the telephone in business. John Cleese shows how best to offend a customer and drive him away over the phone. As well, he gives five simple rules on how to be helpful to customers. Cast includes John Cleese, Dilys Watling, Vivienne Martin, Jacqueline Tong, Norman Bird.

results.title: When Harry met Sally...
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Rob Reiner and Andrew Scheinman
results.brief_description: Infamous for it’s restaurant scene that provokes the, “I’ll have what she’s having” line, this romantic comedy written by Nora Ephron follows the slowly developing relationship between Harry Burns (Billy Crystal) and Sally Albright (Meg Ryan). Harry and Sally meet in the 1970’s when they share a car trip courtesy of a mutual friend. They never run out of things to say, and Harry sticks by his proclamation that men cannot be friends with attractive women. Over the course of the next 10 years, both of them fall in and out of love, grow closer as friends, and contemplate a romantic future together when they cross the boundary between friends and lovers in a moment of emotional weakness. This film provided played a pivotal role in the renaissance of modern romantic comedy, led by Nora Ephron who went on to be involved in films such as “Sleepless in Seattle” and “You’ve got mail”, both of which featured Meg Ryan in the romantic lead. Cast also includes Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby.
